alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL ISLE OF WIGHT ...THE CITY OF HAMPTON AND THE CENTRAL CITY OF NEWPORT NEWS THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Isle Of Wight, or near Windsor, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Smithfield and Isle Of Wight around 430 PM EDT. Rescue around 445 PM EDT. Newport News around 455 PM EDT. Christopher Newport University and Beaconsdale around 500 PM EDT. Hampton and Northampton around 505 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Carrollton, Longview, Benns Church, Bethel Church, Hilton Village, Lawson, Central Hill, Whitley, Oyster Point, and Mogarts Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News
